repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
- The :Evaluate result window is not cleaned up when the cursor moves.
- This window is not focusable.

Solution:
Replace the old implementation from autozimu/LanguageClient-neovim with vim.lsp.util.open_floating_preview and implement custom focusing logic. Also remove g:termdebug_useFloatingHover option now that it's working correctly.

comment_data.body:
Our termdebug has diverged quite a bit from Vim's, so this section is out-of-date anyway.

I don't think it's so valuable to log these small differences here any more, so I'd be OK if it was removed (or replaced with a general comment that the files have diverged).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -35,21 +35,14 @@
 " The communication with gdb uses GDB/MI.  See:
 " https://sourceware.org/gdb/current/onlinedocs/gdb/GDB_002fMI.html
 "
-" For neovim compatibility, the vim specific calls were replaced with neovim
-" specific calls:
-"   term_start -> termopen
-"   term_sendkeys -> chansend
-"   term_getline -> getbufline
-"   job_info && term_getjob -> using linux command ps to get the tty
-"   balloon -> nvim floating window
+" NEOVIM COMPATIBILITY
 "
-" The code for opening the floating window was taken from the beautiful
-" implementation of LanguageClient-Neovim:
-" https://github.com/autozimu/LanguageClient-neovim/blob/0ed9b69dca49c415390a8317b19149f97ae093fa/autoload/LanguageClient.vim#L304
-"
-" Neovim terminal also works seamlessly on windows, which is why the ability
-" Author: Bram Moolenaar
-" Copyright: Vim license applies, see ":help license"
+" The vim specific functionalities were replaced with neovim specific calls:
+" - term_start -> termopen
+" - term_sendkeys -> chansend
+" - term_getline -> getbufline
+" - job_info && term_getjob -> using linux command ps to get the tty
+" - balloon -> vim.lsp.util.open_floating_preview

comment_data.body:
I think it's worth jumping into the existing float only if the second `:Evaluate` is called without arguments.

That way, only `:Evaluate` (with no arguments) or `K` jumps into the float if `:Evaluate foo` was executed initially, but `:Evaluate bar` after `:Evaluate foo` does not (and instead opens a float with the result of evaluating `bar`'s expression).

Likewise, this could be extended to also jump if `:Evaluate foo` is executed twice (same argument both times), but I don't think that's so important (or desirable).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1313,7 +1306,13 @@ endfunc
 
 " :Evaluate - evaluate what is specified / under the cursor
 func s:Evaluate(range, arg)
+  if s:eval_float_win_id > 0 && nvim_win_is_valid(s:eval_float_win_id)
+    call nvim_set_current_win(s:eval_float_win_id)
+    return
+  endif

comment_data.body: That's OK. If it's ever wanted, some of `split_message`'s logic can be ported over into termdebug (even if it's to only make structs look nicer).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1392,9 +1393,15 @@ func s:HandleEvaluate(msg)
     else
       let s:evalFromBalloonExprResult .= ' = ' . value
     endif
-    let s:evalFromBalloonExprResult = split(s:evalFromBalloonExprResult, '\\n')
-    call s:OpenHoverPreview(s:evalFromBalloonExprResult, v:null)
-    let s:evalFromBalloonExprResult = ''
+    " NEOVIM:
+    " - Result pretty-printing is not implemented. Vim prettifies the result
+    "   with balloon_split(), which is not ported to nvim.

comment_data.body: I think the point here is as a first guide for unsuspecting goobers trying to port a runtime file update, so this list might still be useful information?

comment_data.body: Might still be useful then. Could do with some sprucing up though (later), it hasn't been touched much since the original port. (also is that `ps` comment even correct? :thinking:)

comment_data.body: `balloon` comment is from <del>this PR</del> actually it's from the original port too (derp), as Vim uses :balloon: tooltips for showing eval when hovering the mouse over a variable (similar to a floating window in the sense that it pops out, I suppose; also `balloon_show` was used in a similar place as `open_floating_preview` and `nvim_open_win` before it).

comment_data.body: The ps thing was indeed outdated (since the initial nvim support was added :grin:), and `nvim_get_chan_info` is used instead. Otherwise looks fine, though I haven't really tried to fully understand the implementation.

comment_data.body:
Thanks! I think the list looks fine now.

I also see `uv.kill` replacing `job_stop` for sending SIGINT, but I'll have to do a more thorough review later to see if there's more differences.

title: fix(termdebug): improve :Evaluate floating window
